title: A weekend in . . . Vichy, France
text:
Paul Lamarra Last updated at 12:01AM, August 15 2015 
Within minutes of arriving in the spa town of Vichy I had put my foot in it. I asked at the tourist information centre about the town’s wartime role as capital of the “free zone” — the corner of France in which the invading Nazis initially had no interest — and I was met with a confused frown. Apparently in Vichy you follow the Fawlty Towers adage: “Don’t mention the war.” 
The war was a game changer for Vichy. In June 1940 while coastal resorts from Deauville to Biarritz were taping their windows and boxing their china, Vichy was welcoming the French Subscribe now
